channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Could MrBeast IPO? His CEO wants fans to have ‘a chance to be owners of the company’
item.description: Would you buy stock in a twenty-seven-year-old named Jimmy?

item.title: Coup de tonnerre chez Apple : le père de Liquid Glass claque la porte, et d’autres cadres pourraient le suivre
item.description: Meta fait un nouveau recrutement féroce, le géant a réussi à débaucher le chef de l'UI d'Apple, notamment responsable de Liquid Glass.

item.title: ‘The Batman Part II’ May Be Adding a Black Widow, Scarlett Johansson
item.description: The former Marvel star is in talks to join Robert Pattinson in the 2027 Matt Reeves DC film.

item.title: Roblox banned in Russia, local media says
item.description: Russia's communications agency cited the presence of LGBTQ content on the platform as one of the reasons behind the ban.

item.title: BMW iX3 first drive: a ‘New Class’ is in session
item.description: BMW has been peppering us with teasers and bits and pieces about its next-gen EV platform, Neue Klasse, for so long - fully two years now - that I confess I've become a bit numb to the hype. I'd seen the dashboard-filling displays, talked to engineers endlessly about the completely retooled active safety suite, and […]

item.title: BMW iX3 2026 Review: Price, Specs, Availability
item.description: BMW’s first car on its new EV platform has finally arrived. But will a big range, thumping charging tech, and a new driving brain that aims to deliver the ultimate ride be enough to beat China?

item.title: Missed out on Black Friday? Elegoo's 3D printer deals see up to 53% off on printers, filament and resins in its early Christmas sale
item.description: Elegoo is offering up to 53% off its latest 3D printers, filament, and resins from now until December 25.

item.title: Palantir CEO Says Making War Crimes Constitutional Would Be Good for Business
item.description: Alex Karp vows to use his "whole influence" on immigration and defense policy.

item.title: Pénurie de mémoire : ce constructeur historique jette l’éponge, c’est une très mauvaise nouvelle, la crise va empirer
item.description: C'est une véritable crise dans la crise. Alors que les prix de la mémoire vive flambent, le constructeur historique Crucial annonce son retrait du marché grand public.

item.title: Watch what may be Apple's most inspiring video ever
item.description: Apple celebrated International Day of Persons with Disabilities with an incredible video that reminds us that we're all just average human messes.

item.title: Is this our first look at Intel's Xeon 6 workstation hardware? Leak claims to show W890 platform ahead of Granite Rapids launch
item.description: New hardware details and benchmark entries reinforce Intel’s shift toward next-generation Xeon 6 systems aimed at demanding workstation and server environments.

item.title: The Auk Mini Herb Garden Is Still Up to $30 Off (2025)
item.description: Missed out on Cyber Monday? Auk Mini's stylish herb garden makes a great gift, and its discount is still live.

item.title: The Trump administration keeps taking stakes in chipmakers — it may come back to haunt them
item.description: These ongoing entanglements raise the question of whether the government is best positioned to help these companies prosper. The Trump administration is planning to buy a direct stake in yet another chip technology company. Earlier this week, the Commerce Department announced that it had signed a letter of intent to buy up to $150 million of xLight, a startup that focuses on lithography, a critical part of the semiconductor-manufacturing process. ...

item.title: Satellites keep photobombing the Hubble telescope, and it’s getting worse
item.description: It’s getting harder and harder for the Hubble and other telescopes orbiting Earth to capture pristine images thanks to the sudden surge in satellite launches. Satellite trails could mess up nearly 40 percent of images the Hubble takes and up to 96 percent of those taken by three other telescopes over the next decade, according […]

item.title: This Microbe ‘Plays Dead’ in NASA Clean Rooms, and We May Have Sent It to Mars
item.description: 18 years ago, a sneaky bacteria infiltrated some of the cleanest places on Earth. Scientists finally know how.

item.title: Andy Jassy says Amazon’s Nvidia competitor chip is already a multibillion-dollar business
item.description: Can any company, big or small, really topple Nvidia's AI chip dominance? Maybe not entirely, but Amazon is already making big bucks trying.

item.title: Gemini 3 Pro scores 69% trust in blinded testing up from 16% for Gemini 2.5: The case for evaluating AI on real-world trust, not academic benchmarks
item.description: Just a few short weeks ago, Google debuted its Gemini 3 model, claiming it scored a leadership position in multiple AI benchmarks. But the challenge with vendor-provided benchmarks is that they are just that — vendor-provided. A new vendor-neutral evaluation from Prolific, however, puts Gemini 3 at the top of the leaderboard. This isn't on a set of academic benchmarks; rather, it's on a set of real-world attributes that actual users and organizations care about. Prolific was founded by researchers at the University of Oxford. The company delivers high-quality, reliable human data to power rigo...

item.title: 50+ Walmart Cyber Monday deals still live: Last chance to get Magic Bullet blenders for $15, MacBooks for $499
item.description: It's your last chance to get M1 MacBook Airs for $499, $399 Dyson vacuums, and PS5 bundles. See the latest Walmart Cyber Monday deals.

item.title: iOS 26 Messages brings transformative new group chat features
item.description: iOS 26 includes new group chat features like typing indicators, polls, Apple Cash, customizable chat backgrounds, and more.

item.title: The Age-Gated Internet Is Sweeping the US. Activists Are Fighting Back
item.description: Half of the country now requires age verification to watch porn or access “harmful” content. Digital rights advocates are pushing back against legislation they say will make the internet less safe.

item.title: Bryan Fuller Reveals the Inspirations for His Dark Fairytale Feature Debut
item.description: 'Dust Bunny' reunites Fuller with 'Hannibal' star Mads Mikkelsen and hits theaters December 12.

item.title: Anthropic’s AI bubble ‘YOLO’ warning
item.description: This is an excerpt of Sources by Alex Heath, a newsletter about AI and the tech industry, syndicated just for The Verge subscribers once a week. Dario Amodei took the stage at the DealBook Summit on Wednesday to throw punches without naming names. The Anthropic CEO spent a good chunk of the interview with Andrew […]

item.title: Meta hires away Apple’s top design exec
item.description: Alan Dye, head of Apple’s human interface design team since 2015, is joining Meta to build a new design studio. Apple just lost a top design talent.

item.title: I tested 30 smart locks, and these are the best
item.description: A smart lock is an easy solution to some common problems. Locked yourself out? Need to let a friend in to water the plants? Your latchkey kid lost their key? Hands are full, and it’s raining cats and dogs? A smart lock solves all of these problems and more. One of the best smart home […]

item.title: The Galaxy S25 FE has all the looks of the Galaxy S25 Plus, but none of the snap
item.description: The Galaxy S25 FE is a solid phone that struggles to stand out as the Galaxy S25 Plus and other rivals offer a better experience.

item.title: That's what I call a dip - world's largest derivatives exchange shut down by embarrassing data center cooling issue
item.description: CME halted global trading due to a cooling failure at its data center, revealing risks in automated systems and high-value transactions.

item.title: Trumps Scores Big Win for Gas Guzzlers, but Not All Auto Giants Are On Board
item.description: "Today, we're taking one more step to kill the 'Green New Scam,'" Trump said.

item.title: Daniel Radcliffe, Jonathan Groff, and Lindsay Mendez dish on bringing Merrily We Roll Along from stage to screen
item.description: "Merrily We Roll Along" stars Daniel Radcliffe, Jonathan Groff, and Lindsay Mendez dive into the film version of their Tony–winning musical.

item.title: Our favorite Ninja gifts are still on sale for Cyber Week — save 43% on blenders, air fryers, and ice cream makers
item.description: First Black Friday, then Cyber Monday, then Cyber Week. Whatever you call it, Ninja appliances are up to 38% off for a little while longer.

item.title: Fake AI-generated shops, ads flourish on Facebook
item.description: Scammers are still a big problem on Facebook's ad platform — especially in the age of AI.
